en.title: How you can proceed with your divorce
en.courtHearsBothParties: The court usually needs to hear from both parties in a marriage before it can grant a divorce.
en.infoToContactRespondent: If it's safe to do so, usually the simplest way to proceed is to contact your {{ case.divorceWho }} directly to find out why they haven't responded. They can still send in their response after the deadline has passed.
en.provideNewAddrToCourt: If you can't get in contact with your {{ case.divorceWho }}, you may want to consider asking their family, friends and workplace if they have a new address, and provide that to the court.
en.noResponseOptions: If there's still no response using the original address, you have the following options available to you, depending on your situation.

haveAnotherAddress.linkSummary: I have another residential address or a solicitor's address for my {{ case.divorceWho }} (no fee)
haveAnotherAddress.provideAddress: Contact the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre to provide a different address for your {{ case.divorceWho }}. This can be a UK or international address.
haveAnotherAddress.noExtraPay: You don't have to pay anything extra to have the application sent to a different address.

sendToWorkAddress.linkSummary: I need to send the application to a non-residential address, eg a work address (£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
sendToWorkAddress.askToSendApp: You can ask for the application to be sent to a non-residential address.

needToSearchRecords.linkSummary: I need to search government records for my {{ case.divorceWho }}’s address (£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
needToSearchRecords.canApplyIfRespLivesInEngWales: You can apply for a search of government databases (eg the electoral role) for your {{ case.divorceWho }}’s address. Your {{ case.divorceWho }} must live in England or Wales.
needToSearchRecords.applyViaSearchRecords: Contact the service centre and ask for the form to be sent to you.

sendEmailToResp.linkSummary: I need to send the application to my {{ case.divorceWho }}'s email address (£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
sendEmailToResp.appToEmail: You can ask for the application to be delivered by email.

believeRespChoseNotToRespond.linkSummary: I believe my {{ case.divorceWho }} lives at that address, but chose not to respond (£{{ enforcemetFee }})
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.deliverPapersDirectlyToResp: If you think that your {{ case.divorceWho }} is deliberately not responding you can pay a professional to deliver (serve) the divorce papers directly to them.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.optionsToDeliver: You can do this by using either a:
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.courtEmpToDeliver: Court bailiff (an employee of the courts)
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.processServerDetails: Contact a local solicitor who should be able to give you the contact details for a local company.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.courtBailifDetails1: The bailiff service can only be used at addresses in England and Wales where delivery by post has already failed. If you have a new address for your {{ case.divorceWho }}, you’ll have to get it delivered by post before you can apply for the bailiff service.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.courtBailifDetails2: If the bailiff succeeds in delivering the application, you'll be given a letter as evidence that your {{ case.divorceWho }} has received the application. This is known as an ‘endorsement of service'. If your {{ case.divorceWho }} doesn’t respond within 14 days of getting the application, you can use this letter to continue your divorce without their response.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.formD89: form D89. Send the form to the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.moreToSend: You'll also need to send the following:
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.divorceAppCopy: a copy of your divorce application

evidenceRespWontRespond.linkSummary: I have evidence that my {{ case.divorceWho }} received the application, but can't or won't respond (£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
evidenceRespWontRespond.canApplyForDeemedServ: If you know your {{ case.divorceWho }} received the application, but can’t or won’t respond, you can apply to the court for a ‘deemed service’. This means that the court will decide that your {{ case.divorceWho }} has received the application, and that you can continue without their response.
evidenceRespWontRespond.needToProve: You need to be able to prove that your {{ case.divorceWho }} received the application (eg, you have a text message from {{ case.divorceWho }} saying they received it).
evidenceRespWontRespond.applyAndSendDocs: Send the form and documents to the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre.

doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.linkSummary: I’ve tried every possible way of delivering the application (£{{feeToResendApplication }})
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.askForDispenseWithService: Under exceptional circumstances, you can ask the court to ‘dispense with service’ (decide your {{ case.divorceWho }} doesn’t have to be served the divorce application).
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.allInCourtHands: It’s up to the court to decide whether to grant this. Before it can be considered, you’ll need to show that you’ve done everything you can to find them by contacting their:
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.searchInGovtDB: You'll also need to have tried to find their address by searching for it on government databases.
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.applyD13bLink: form D13b.
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.applyD11AndD13bContent: Send the forms to the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre.

en.applyD11: form D11.
en.howToPayContent: Call the service centre to make the £{{ feeToResendApplication }} payment by card (Monday - Friday 8am to 8pm, Saturday 8am to 2pm) or include a cheque with your form.
en.howToPayBailiffContent: Call the service centre to make the £{{ enforcemetFee }} payment by card (Monday - Friday 8am to 8pm, Saturday 8am to 2pm) or include a cheque with your form.
en.getNewRefNumb: If you're eligible for help with fees you'll need to apply again and get a new reference number.
en.extraCosts: If you asked the court to order your {{ case.divorceWho }} to pay your costs, then these extra costs will also be taken into account.
en.printAndSend: Send the form to the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre.
en.howRespondsLink: How your {{ case.divorceWho }} responds
en.decreeNisiLink: Decree nisi
en.decreeAbsoluteLink: Decree absolute
en.childrenAndDivorceLink: Children and divorce
en.moneyAndPropertyLink: Money and property
en.solicitorLink: solicitor or legal adviser

cy.title: Sut y gallwch barhau â’ch ysgariad
cy.courtHearsBothParties: Gan amlaf, bydd y llys angen clywed gan y ddau barti yn y briodas cyn y gall ganiatáu ysgariad.
cy.infoToContactRespondent: Os yw’n ddiogel ichi wneud hynny, gan amlaf y ffordd symlaf i barhau ydi ichi gysylltu â’ch {{ case.divorceWho }} yn uniongyrchol i ddarganfod pam nad ydynt wedi ymateb.  Gallant dal anfon eu hymateb hyd yn oed ar ôl i'r terfyn amser basio.
cy.provideNewAddrToCourt: Os na allwch gysylltu â’ch {{ case.divorceWho }}, efallai yr hoffech ystyried gofyn i’w teulu, ffrindiau neu eu gweithle os oes ganddynt gyfeiriad newydd, a rhoi hwnnw i'r llys.
cy.noResponseOptions: Os na cheir ymateb o hyd gan ddefnyddio’r cyfeiriad gwreiddiol, mae gennych yr opsiynau canlynol, yn dibynnu ar eich sefyllfa.
cy.whichSituation: Pa sefyllfa sy’n berthnasol i chi?

haveAnotherAddress.linkSummary: Mae gen i gyfeiriad preswyl arall neu gyfeiriad arall ar gyfer cyfreithiwr fy {{ case.divorceWho }} (no fee)
haveAnotherAddress.provideAddress: Cysylltwch â’r Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd i ddarparu cyfeiriad gwahanol ar gyfer eich {{ case.divorceWho }}. Gall hwn fod yn gyfeiriad yn y DU neu’n gyfeiriad rhyngwladol.
haveAnotherAddress.noExtraPay: Nid oes rhaid ichi dalu mwy i anfon y cais i gyfeiriad gwahanol.

sendToWorkAddress.linkSummary: Rwyf angen anfon y cais i gyfeiriad dibreswyl, e.e. cyfeiriad gwaith (Â£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
sendToWorkAddress.askToSendApp: Gallwch ofyn i'r cais gael ei anfon i gyfeiriad dibreswyl.

needToSearchRecords.linkSummary: Rwyf angen chwilio cofnodion y llywodraeth i ddod o hyd i gyfeiriad fy {{ case.divorceWho }} (Â£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
needToSearchRecords.canApplyIfRespLivesInEngWales: Gallwch wneud cais i chwilio cronfeydd data’r llywodraeth (e.e. y gofrestr etholwyr) i ddod o hyd i gyfeiriad eich {{ case.divorceWho }}. Mae’n rhaid bod eich {{ case.divorceWho }} yn byw yng Nghymru a Lloegr.
needToSearchRecords.applyViaSearchRecords: Cysylltwch â'r Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd i ofyn iddynt anfon y ffurflen atoch.

sendEmailToResp.linkSummary: Rwyf angen anfon y cais i gyfeiriad e-bost fy {{ case.divorceWho }} (Â£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
sendEmailToResp.appToEmail: Gallwch ofyn i'r cais gael ei anfon drwy e-bost.

believeRespChoseNotToRespond.linkSummary: Credaf bod fy {{ case.divorceWho }} yn byw yn y cyfeiriad hwnnw, ond wedi penderfynu peidio ag ymateb (Â£{{ enforcemetFee }})
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.deliverPapersDirectlyToResp: Os ydych yn credu bod eich {{ case.divorceWho }} yn peidio ag ymateb yn fwriadol, gallwch dalu i unigolyn proffesiynol ddanfon (cyflwyno) y papurau ysgariad yn uniongyrchol iddynt.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.optionsToDeliver: Gallwch wneud hyn drwy naill ai ddefnyddio:
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.privateHireToDeliver: Cyflwynydd proses (unigolyn proffesiynol sydd wedi'i gyflogi’n breifat)
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.processServerDetails: Cysylltwch â chyfreithiwr lleol a ddylai allu rhoi manylion cyswllt cwmni lleol ichi.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.courtBailifDetails1: Dim ond mewn cyfeiriadau yng Nghymru a Lloegr y gellir defnyddio'r gwasanaeth beili lle mae anfon y cais drwy'r post eisoes wedi methu.  Os oes gennych gyfeiriad newydd ar gyfer eich {{ case.divorceWho }}, bydd rhaid anfon y cais drwy'r post i'r cyfeiriad hwnnw cyn y gallwch wneud cais am wasanaeth beili.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.courtBailifDetails2: Os yw’r beili’n llwyddo i ddanfon y cais, fe gewch lythyr fel tystiolaeth bod eich {{ case.divorceWho }} wedi cael y cais.  Gelwir hyn yn 'ardystiad cyflwyno'. Os na fydd eich {{ case.divorceWho }} yn ymateb ymhen 14 diwrnod iddynt gael y cais, gallwch ddefnyddio'r llythyr hwn i barhau gyda’ch ysgariad heb eu hymateb.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.formD89: ffurflen D89. Anfonwch y ffurflen i'r Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd.
believeRespChoseNotToRespond.moreToSend: Bydd angen ichi hefyd anfon y canlynol:

evidenceRespWontRespond.linkSummary: Mae gen i dystiolaeth bod fy {{ case.divorceWho }} wedi cael y cais, ond ni all neu nid yw am ymateb (Â£{{ feeToResendApplication }})
evidenceRespWontRespond.canApplyForDeemedServ: Os ydych yn gwybod bod eich {{ case.divorceWho }} wedi cael y cais, ond ni all neu nid yw am ymateb, gallwch wneud cais i’r llys am orchymyn 'cyflwyno tybiedig'. Golyga hyn y bydd y llys yn penderfynu bod eich {{ case.divorceWho }} wedi cael y cais, ac y gallwch barhau heb eu hymateb.
evidenceRespWontRespond.needToProve: Bydd angen ichi allu profi bod eich {{ case.divorceWho }} wedi cael y cais (e.e. mae gennych neges testun gan {{ case.divorceWho }} yn dweud eu bod wedi’i gael).
evidenceRespWontRespond.applyAndSendDocs: Anfonwch y ffurflen a'r dogfennau i'r Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd.

doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.linkSummary: Rwyf wedi rhoi cynnig ar bob ffordd bosibl o ddanfon y cais (Â£{{feeToResendApplication }})
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.askForDispenseWithService: O dan amgylchiadau arbennig, gallwch ofyn i'r llys 'hepgor cyflwyno' (penderfynu nad oes rhaid cyflwyno'r cais am ysgariad) i {{ case.divorceWho }}.
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.allInCourtHands: Y llys fydd yn penderfynu a ddylid caniatáu hyn ai peidio.  Cyn gall y llys ystyried hyn, bydd angen ichi ddangos eich bod wedi gwneud popeth y gallwch i ddod o hyd iddynt drwy gysylltu â’u:
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.searchInGovtDB: Bydd angen ichi hefyd fod wedi ceisio dod o hyd i'w cyfeiriad drwy chwilio amdano ar gronfeydd data'r llywodraeth.
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.applyD13bLink: ffurflen D13b.
doneWithAllWaysOfDelivering.applyD11AndD13bContent: Anfonwch y ffurflenni i'r Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd.

cy.applyD11: ffurflen D11.
cy.howToPayContent: Ffoniwch y Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd i dalu’r ffi o Â£{{ feeToResendApplication }} gyda cherdyn (rhwng 8.30am - 5pm) neu fel arall anfonwch siec gyda’ch ffurflen.
cy.howToPayBailiffContent: Ffoniwch y Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd i dalu’r ffi o Â£{{ enforcemetFee }} gyda cherdyn (rhwng 8.30am - 5pm) neu fel arall anfonwch siec gyda’ch ffurflen.
cy.getNewRefNumb: Os ydych chi’n gymwys i gael help i dalu ffioedd llysoedd a thribiwnlysoedd, bydd angen ichi wneud cais arall a chael cyfeirnod newydd.
cy.extraCosts: Os gofynnoch i'r llys orchymyn bod eich {{ case.divorceWho }} yn talu'ch costau, yna bydd y costau ychwanegol hyn hefyd yn cael eu hystyried.
cy.printAndSend: Anfonwch y ffurflen i'r Gwasanaeth Llysoedd a Thribiwnlysoedd.
cy.howRespondsLink: Sut mae eich {{ case.divorceWho }} yn ymateb
cy.decreeNisiLink: Dyfarniad Nisi
cy.decreeAbsoluteLink: Dyfarniad Absoliwt
cy.childrenAndDivorceLink: Plant ac ysgariad
cy.moneyAndPropertyLink: Arian ac eiddo
cy.solicitorLink: cyfreithiwr neu gynghorydd cyfreithiol
